refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Pass in the template function name, followed by the PHP function name that implements it.
The php-function callback impl can be either

listitem.para: a string containing the function name
an array of the form array(&$object, $method) with &$object being a reference to an object and $method being a string containing the mehod-name
an array of the form array(&$class, $method) with $class being a classname and $method being a class method of that class.

refsect1.para: cacheable and cache_attrs can be omitted in most cases. See Controlling Cacheability of Plugins' Output on how to use them properly.

example.title: register_function()
example.programlisting:
<?php
$smarty->register_function('date_now', 'print_current_date');

function print_current_date($params)
{
  if(empty($params['format'])) {
    $format = "%b %e, %Y";
  } else {
    $format = $params['format'];
    return strftime($format,time());
  }
}
?>

refsect1.para: See also unregister_function() and Plugin functions .
